decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON:  To comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents: 2021127.P101, 2021127.PA.P102 Revision: P02 (Existing and Proposed Plans), 2021127.PA.P102 Revision: P02 (Existing and Proposed Elevations), 2021127.P104 Revision: P02, 2021127.P105.
REASON: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.
REASON: To safeguard the character and appearance of the area in accordance with Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012) and Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).

Condition : 4 - The roof area of the extension hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area without the grant of further specific permission from the local planning authority.
REASON: To safeguard the residential  amenities of neighbouring residents, in accordance with Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).

Condition : 5 - Notwithstanding the approved plans, the development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until details of revised cycle parking and refuse storage arrangements have been submitted to, and approved in writing by the local planning authority.

The submitted details shall indicate the siting of cycle stores within the private rear garden areas of each respective flat, and bins shall be sited within enclosures also within the private rear garden areas of each respective flat. Furthermore, the submitted details shall include proposed elevation details of the proposed refuse and cycle stores together with details of the proposed external materials. The cycle stores should be shown to accommodate cycle storage for two cycles for each flat, and each refuse store should provide capacity to accommodate a total of three wheelie bins (1x refuse storage bin, 1x recycling storage bin and 1x organic waste Storage bin). The development shall be carried out in accordance with the details as so agreed prior to the first occupation of the development and shall be retained thereafter. 

REASON: To ensure that the proposed refuse and cycles storage are acceptable in terms of their appearance and size, and to safeguard the character and appearance of the area.

Condition : 6 - The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until details of proposed side and rear boundary treatment (including detail on the new side access gates) have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.

The submitted detail shall indicate the design, materials, height of proposed boundary treatment and new side access gates.

The development shall be completed in accordance with the approved details and shall thereafter be retained.

REASON: To safeguard the amenity of neighbouring residents and the character of the locality.
description: Single storey rear extension to ground floor flat, 209 (to create 1 x 2 bed flat): first floor rear extension; rear dormer; two rooflights in front roofslope to first floor flat, 209a (to create 1 x 3 bed flat); external alterations
